info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 1:58AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Litchfield County through 245 AM EDT... At 158 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Torrington, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Torrington, New Hartford, Litchfield, Winsted, New Hartford Center, Northwest Harwinton, Harwinton, Barkhamsted, Goshen, Colebrook, West Torrington, Torringford, Haight Vineyard, Mooreville, Nepaug, Riverton, Kelly Corner, Mill Brook, West Goshen and Beech Rock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
